title: @Riot Poll for Blood Moon Elise skin color change
body:
Hey guys! 

I just recently purchased the blood moon Elise skin and hoped it would have reverted back to the original pink color first previewed on the PBE. 

Do you guys want blood moon Elise skin color reverted back to pink? Vote now!

replies.body:
Hey there! 

Unfortunately, since she's already on live, we won't be making any more color changes to her.

If you have feedback for something that's on PBE (i.e. future content), make your voice heard by making a post on the PBE board, this board, etc! We welcome all feedback, positive and negative, and the sooner it's given to us, the sooner we can discuss it, and potentially make changes. :]

See when steel legion hit PBE a large portion of the community voiced that they didnt want another military skin, but Morello said since it hit the PBE and the work has been done already they were going to release it anyway, which leaves me with the impression that when something hits the PBE specifically when its a skin, there is little room for change or taking back the skin. 

Now I think it was you or another Rioter who said that the pink colour scheme could be in a skin in the future, but even if that were the case Elise won't see a skin for at least 2 years, or at least that should be the logic since champions like Lux haven't see a new skin for at least 2 years(could be longer until a skin is actually released) and other champions haven't seen a new skin for even longer like Zilean.  

tl;dr     Elise players are going to have to wait a long time to see another skin to rectify this situation.

I did say that pink could be a potential option to explore in the future for Elise! 

In regards to PBE, it's very unlikely that we'll completely scrap an idea once it gets to PBE. Changes, however, are things we're happy to consider and act upon. For example, we changed Blood Moon Elise's color several times (pink, to red, to a happy medium) before deciding on the final color. That decision was based on a couple of things; player's nearly 50/50 split on which color they'd prefer, so we went with a medium between red and pink. It was also based on making sure the skin was cohesive with the Blood Moon skin line - some initial player reactions were that the pink looked more like Heartseeker, rather than Blood Moon, and we felt similarly. 

Keep in mind, that while not everything suggested may be acted upon/changed, we do discuss the feedback that comes in via the boards! :]

The Elise skin doesn't affect me all that much because despite maining her upon release, she's...kinda unplayable atm...having skin for champions you don't play is kinda pointless for me >_>

HOWEVER, what caught my attention was 

> (pink, to red, to a happy medium)

As any psychology major will tell you, compromises are best left as a **last resort** because it gets the job done, but in a way where no one is completely satisfied.

Next time such a thing happens, may I suggest...

Creating a **gigantic discussion thread** inviting only players who own Elise/said champion the skin is for? Sticky it, make it public, and invite heavily moderated discussions.

From an ex-Elise player's perspective, the deep red is better because of consistency. But pink isn't that bad either because Elise is a GIRL. Both sides have legitimate reasons for their colour of choice, appeal for skin-consistency or sex-consistency, both are valid.


Why not round up all players who would have liked to see this sorted out, lay down some ground rules(*"don't call the other side a c*nt"*), and have a discussion with them over it? 
----------
You'll obviously still have people sour over it (the losing side mostly), but **at the very least everyone will feel they've had a semi-fair shot at influencing the product they may potentially buy if it ever comes on sale!**


(as a {{champion:69}} player, I can not stress how badly I wish Stashu had done something like this rather than powering through to satisfy no one)

I think for future content, a thread like that could be super useful, and it's something I've written down should something like this happen again.  As for this skin, there really isn't much more to discuss. It's on live, and more changes won't be made to the skin. 

With that being said, I will say there was a **ton** of discussion around the color of the skin in meetings, thanks to everyone's comments on the boards. I spent several nights digging through these boards, Reddit, Surrender@20, SkinSpotlights videos, etc, screenshotting posts, and compiling feedback into a presentable form for the next meeting. I made sure both sides were heard each time. So, while it may have not been a thread of 'hey, what do you think?' - multiple players' threads and comments were brought up and discussed when it came down to making a final call.
